instructions: Choose a pot with drainage holes.
Sow seeds 0.5 cm deep and water lightly.
Place in a warm, sunny location (6–8 hrs light).
warnings: Avoid overwatering as seeds can rot.
did_you_know: Basil is native to tropical regions from Central Africa to Southeast Asia.
The name 'basil' comes from the Greek word 'basileus', meaning 'king'.

instructions_add: Ensure your indoor pot has a saucer to catch water.
tips_add: Rotate pot weekly for even light exposure if growing near a window.
Ensure good air circulation around indoor basil in humid climates to prevent fungal issues.
warnings_add: In very humid indoor settings, avoid misting basil leaves directly.

tips_add: Basil is quite resilient, so don't be afraid to experiment a little!

instructions: Keep soil moist but not wet.
tips: Cover with a plastic wrap to retain moisture.

instructions: Start harvesting leaves when 6–8 inches tall.
